intro: Chamaesyce vahlii, commonly known as the desert sandmat, is a flowering plant native to arid regions of North America. It is a low-growing perennial herb that typically forms dense mats on the ground. The plant has small, fleshy leaves that are adapted to conserve water in dry environments. Its flowers are usually yellow or greenish-yellow, appearing in clusters near the base of the plant. Chamaesyce vahlii plays a role in stabilizing sandy soils and providing habitat for small desert organisms.
